review: We recently went to Red Robin in between shopping for a quick bite to eat and a get a drink. We sat at the high tables near the bar. We ordered our first drink and waited 20 minutes to receive them, even though the bar was right in front of us. We eventually placed our order, asking for an appetizer to start. It took a while for the onion rings to come out. Shortly after receiving the app, our main course came out. They really don't give you enough time to finish one meal before the next comes out. They have really good food but just wish their time management was handled better.

It's just not good.  Burger had so much salt it wasn't edible.  Service was below average as she was barely interested in the fact that I only ate a few bites of the burger so I asked to speak to the manager who apologized and offered to make another.  Better burgers at Fuddruckers and Five Guys.  Cheaper too.

Let me first say that my chicken sandwich was great, no complaints there. However, my sweet potato fries were soggy and had no flavor. The service was kind of slow and the place was dirty. The bathrooms weren't well kept and the silverware wasn't all that clean to be honest. The spinach artichoke dip was pretty tasty as well, but the chips they give you stick all together. I must admit though, afterwards I was very thirsty! I feel like I had cotton mouth for hours- so the food must of been very salty. All in all though, it's more of a fast food chain, so I didn't expect the quality to be all that.

Pros: Well what can I say, Red Robin burgers are delicious! Too bad I'm not too into chain restaurants, but after not coming here in a while, I thought it was time to give it another shot. I ordered the Royal Red Robin burger. It was a bacon cheese burger with a sunny side up egg, mmmmm. I'm starting to salivate again just typing about it. The service was good and speedy for a Friday night. The restaurant looked like it was packed but we were seated pretty quickly. Our waitress was a sweetheart and was very patient when we didn't know quite what we wanted yet. Gotta love the bottomless fries and soft drinks! Cons: A little too greasy for my taste. My orange cream soda just tasted like cream soda with whipped cream. My boyfriend decided to try the new Blue Moon shake, but had to send it back because it was just foam and lacked the Blue Moon taste.

Well I loved Red Robin until my experience tonight & it's unfortunate because I was looking forward to it. Burgers were over $11 & I could have made better ones at home.  Not gourmet anymore here.  I asked for medium well & it came back very well.  I told the waitress, but she had a huge sigh when I called over like she couldn't be bothered.  Five Guys blows them away they just don't have alcohol.   I won't be back.
Pissed. Starving. Served me cold (frozen) food.  10 mins still waiting.  Everyone else in my party finished.  Food came back. Still cold. Ate it anyway because I'm starving.  Server good.

I am so upset at my experience here.  The only positive thing was that our party was seated very quickly.  We were greeted by our server who took our drink order.  Upon placing our orders we waited and waited. It took around 20 mins to get our two burgers and two chicken dishes.  For the $52 price tags we got cold fries (who would want bottomless cold greasy fries?), unremarkable tepid bland burgers incorrectly cooked - of course without the blue cheese that was in the menu, white bitter lettuce and a very cold seating area.  My wife's refill of sweet potato fries finally came out after we were done receiving the check and paying.  Poor service, a very poor experience and a dirty restaurant with straw wrappers and used napkins on the floor leaves me no reason or desire to return.  When I asked my son how many stars it had here, he said 2.5.  I was not surprised and rather disappointed.  In VA, RR was a nice pleasant experience.  In NJ, not sure what's happened.  We will not be returning and should have gone to five guys or White Castle.

Me and my sister went here after Xmas shopping and it  was delicious we play games on the tablet (its 1.99 but worth it) our drink was awesome  our waitress was soo friendly and recommend drinks. I don't know why this spot getting sooo many bad review
Sllllllooooowww, tell someone 15 minutes and ends up being 35. Get it together. Byyyyeee Red Robin, hello Five Guy's.
This is probably my favorite burger place. I love that they refill you're fries and it's bottomless but it took forever to get the waiters attention.

Oh boy, what can I say.  They are stuffing more people in than they can keep up with. The bathrooms were so atrocious I almost couldn't eat because I had to experience that on the way in. We had a party of seven and they brought one menu for us. Guess we are supposed to pass it around and share?!? The waitress was friendly, she just had way to much to do. Waited about 45 minutes for food when the people next to us who came after were served in 10 min.  Should have gone to 5 guys across the parking lot!  If you can't keep up with the flow, don't seat anyone else!!!!!!!  All gourmet restaurants should know that LOL! On the way out we rechecked the bathroom. Smells like someone rubbed their poo on the walls. They still haven't cleaned them!!!

Except for the fact that it took us a little while to have someone seat us (because it just opened), the table attendant, Tina, was friendly and excellent. She brought refills for both the drinks and bottomless fries even  before we asked. The food was tasty, the place was clean and I loved the table top game/pay options. I only wished the had a menu for people with special diet options.

I was very disappointed when I was told that you would be open on Thanksgivings but when my family arrived, they were closed. We just needed a place to eat after the Macy's parade, it was a huge let down. The workers that answer the phone should know the facts. I thought we were set with our plans for the day, after many phone calls we finally found a pub open

We come here sporadically throughout the year only because I am beyond impressed with their kids menu. It's been a few months since my last visit and boy have they improved on a lot. There have been some major renovations and the staff has received some much needed training. Once again, kids menu is 5 stars- never a complaint with that- and they added the table touch screen for the kids to play games. Service was great and I saw the manager checking in on tables throughout the dining area. For dessert, we ordered the stack of donuts which were hot, perfectly sized, and came with 2 dipping sauces. We ordered dessert added the loyalty number, and paid for the bill through the touch screen. Very cool and easy with youngsters in tow. My one suggestion is to add hand wipes to your service to families or at least a wet- hand towel to offer to the table.

The Mac & cheese was lacking in the cheese department. And in the taste department. The children's Mac & cheese was watered down.  The fruit was leftover cut up oranges and apples. Salad contained wilted lettuce although the cucumber was crisp.  The grilled chicken burger was good, as was the turkey burger.  Service, non-existent. We told the waitress about the adult Mac & Cheese and she apologized. No offer to replace or refund.  We won't be back, ever.

Went here for a quick lunch with my daughter. We gave ourselves an hour, because she had to go to work.  the food took about 45 minutes from the time we sat down to the time it was delivered (and only after I asked the waitress where our order was).  The fries were cold, and the rest of the food was meh.

Your typical fast food chain restaurant. The Food was good, veggie burger with fries, fish and chips (a bit too oily), onion rings. Service was good. The payment system where you use the computers on the desk are fast and easy.  Overall, I would come back.
Service is horrible. No one to greet customers. Glad we walked out. Where's McDonald's?

We were seated quickly with 5 adults and 2 children. My daughters food was put in wrong and mine was never put in. By the time our food was brought out to us everyone at our table was already done eating.  Being that this was our first time eating here I probably will not revisit this restaurant.

Order the smokey jack double burger, company of 4. On a non packed night. Food came cold and my friend found a bug in his cup. Waitress offer a free double shot , which later he got charged for. After a long conversation with the manager he finally came around. Never coming back.

stopped in for lunch with my husband as we had a gift card haven't been in a long time went down hill by far. I ordered an iced tea with kettle one thanking like every other place it would be charged as a kettle one mixed drink they charge me for a full ice tea plus the Price of kettle one?? They said they don't use a full shot in there mixed drinks that's why they charged me separate. I guess you don't want to drink there since they're ripping you off. Wanted to mention first when we walked in the hostess had not one ounce of personality don't know where they got her from. The server was OK but needs a lot more training. Came back wants to ask us how our meals were after the appetizer and meals came out at The same time. We were never asked if we want it anymore unlimited french fries. The rolls on the burgers  fell apart. Maybe they should shut this place down at this point

Food is consistently good but come for lunch not dinner or you will be disappointed. Host/Hostess staff needs major customer service skills training, which I noticed across the board in other patron reviews. Also the fact that the bathrooms are always filthy and out of paper.  Weekends and holidays I would chose another location to eat. Just not worth the hassle.

Came here hoping that it would be just like the Red Robin near me and it wasn't. The burger was decent, but the meal my mom ordered came out wrong and the bread was stale. Not sure if I would come back to this one.

We arrived around 11:30 for a customer lunch and the place was empty.  The hostess quickly sat us and the waiter came over to take our drink order.  He returned quickly with our drinks and took our food order. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time.  The last time I had eaten at a Red Robin was years ago and I don't remember the experience being especially good.  My expectations were low.  My chicken sandwich arrived at the table exactly as I had ordered it.  The food runner that brought us the food took our request for sauces and came back in a reasonable amount of time with the goods. The fries were a bit soggy, but the chicken sandwich was good and the BBQ sauce had a nice tang to it.  My colleagues enjoyed their meals as well. I can't say that I would go out of my way to visit another Red Robin, but this experience was not bad.

Admittedly Surprised! I originally came to RR for lunch to try something from the 6.99 cheesy menu  but I got stuck in the appetizer page.  They now have GREAT NORTHERN POUTINE FRIES. An extremely tasty order of steak fries smothered in brown grave (definitely canned or powdered - but it worked), garlic aioli, sautéed mushrooms, and cheese curds.   This by far is the best thing that has appeared on the Red Robin Menu.   Now to the mediocre boneless Buzz Wings. Two words describe them:  dry and dryer. They were overcooked and not enough buzz sauce to make up for it.   They definitely bring some heat so if you order them, ask for ranch or blue cheese, but I will stick to the POUTINE FRIES! The fries are worth the visit!
Not a good experience at all. Service was really mediocre food remind me of Macdonalds hamburgers, asked for refill of fries which never came  Would never be back

Worst waitress ever. Did not greet us for 10 minutes. Couldn't find the allergy menu for me. Brought me seasoned fries after I asked for unseasoned allergy free fries. Did not bring the sauce, tomatoes, and pickles we asked for. Sat us at a table for six, gave us 8 place settings when we were a party of 7.
Was seated quickly ... food was good and service was as well .. my advice - wait for a booth ... a family of 6 sat next to us and decided they needed to expand their space , invading ours ...

This place used to be good when they first opened. Time and time again- very slow service. Rude management. Had to wait 45 minutes for 1 cheeseburger and an order of kids chicken fingers. Everyone else around us was seated after us and ate before us. When I asked to speak to a manager the manager did not seem phased at all and appeared to be bothered that I asked to talk to him. He did, however, comp our meal. He claimed the kitchen was backed up, but then why was everyone else eating and not us? A few times we have gone and the order comes out incorrect or we get the appetizers with the burgers. For a place where everything is deep fried or burgers are put through a conveyor belt to cook, it shouldn't be this difficult.

We came here on our way back from Bushkill , PA. This Red Robin is located in Rockaway TownSquare Mall which is a pretty decent mall. This Red Robin is located across from H&M. The bathroom this day was gross and smelly. The hosts were very nice and attentive. My friends and I weren't really that hungry so the waitress had very easy orders. I ordered the sangria (wasn't strong enough for me) and chili cheese fries which were just okay. The tablet on the tables are for paying your bill, playing games (which they charge you for.. Beware) and ordering desserts. Overall, I would return to try one of their infamous burgers. Just wish they would have told us there was an entertainment fee for the playing games on the tablet

Have been wanting to go for a long time.  Pass a Red Robin every year when drive to Hershey Park.  A family member had good things to say. Just average.  First plate of French fries was ice cold.  Second plate was nice and hot.   Burger tasted ok, but I have tasted much, much better.  Liked the drinks, had some creative lemonade. Price point is excellent.  Service was excellent.

I enjoy burgers.  Any kind of burger.  Red Robin is supposed to specialize in burgers, and was excited to check it out.  It was okay.... just okay.  Service was spotty, and it was hard to flag down our server to get additional napkins, or sweet potatoes fries.  Enjoyed a very large belgian wheat beer which was nice, and the burger was okay, but nothing super memorable.  It's a busy location in a mall with lots of families taking a break from shopping to enjoy some food.  Not in any hurry to return to a Red Robin in the future.

First time for me at Red Robin.  Large selection of burgers and all I wanted was a plain "good" burger....and that's what I got.  Hard to find a good burger place.  Place is clean, service excellent and unlimited fries!!!! I will definitely go back.

Two years ago,  my Yelp review of this location would have been drastically different.  This chain, not just this particular restaurant, has significantly gotten worse.  I suspect it is the usual corporate effect, but the changes are considerable.   I do not like how they are now pushing the "Burger and Brews," because you can do one thing good,  but two things crappy.  This is applicable to Red Robin, because before they focused on Brews, the burgers were good.  Entrance:  You can enter either from the street side, or Rockaway Mall side.  As of recent,  I have not encountered much of a wait.  If the Hostess quotes you a 20 minute wait,  it will really be 10.  Who knows why they overestimate that much.  A negative aspect is that they got rid of their benches out in the mall, for waiting customers.    The hostess is always quick to greet.  For some reason, they always want to seat customers at the tables directly next to the entrance doors, while other tables are open.  They got rid of the one table near the mall entrance, where you were essentially eating your meal with waiting customers. Decor:  I have no idea why they re-designed the restaurant the way they did.  Not only did they get rid of waiting seats, they put up barriers to section off parts of the restaurant.  This makes everything feel more confined and cramped.  I believe there are actually less seats on the floor,  as there were before the monstrosities.  Plus,  the place just does not feel as clean as it was before.  For instance, my table during the last visit still had crumbs on it. Food:  My family and I generally stick to salads and burgers.  If you want onion rings, get them as a side to your burger and not the tower appetizer.  Financially, it is cheaper to subsitute them for your French fries. Over our visits during the past months, we have had problems with our burgers.  From being overcooked,  undercooked, tasteless,  greasy,  and wrong toppings, we have had it all. For instance, my burger during the last visit was undercooked but I ate it anyway and got a stomach ache.  Almost every time, we send the Burgers back to the kitchen and management "Comps" them.  I try not to be a pain, but I want my burgers how they are ordered. I would be remissed if I also did not mention the issue with the salads.  Before all the changes,  the salads, particularly the Southwest Salad, used to be a very big portion and fresh.  Now the prices were raised and the overall salad got smaller.   On our last visit,  the avocado was fresh but lettuce was browning.  It was a very poor and sad $9 salad. Conclusion: The question I would like to present is if corporate is aware of these changes, and how many other customers are having problems as well.  There is only so many meals they can write-off before correcting their mistakes.  Due to the lack of competition in the area,  I continue to be a patron of the establishment.  Time will only tell if Red Robin leads to the same demise as Fuddruckers.

Everybody has their favorite burger chain; Five Guys, Shake Shack, Johnny Rockets, Fuddruckers, and so on...Hands down my favorite has to be Red Robin (RR). RR's burgers are consistently delicious! Moreover, the chain is always showcasing some new burger creation; I think their newest creation is a purger sandwiched between ramen noodles. The RR at the Rockaway mall is large and relatively clean. The large space yields itself for plenty of seats, so waits are not usually an issue. The staff is friendly and, service is snappy. The food is great; and with unlimited french fries who can complain. You can't go wrong with your choice of burger here.  However, if you are overwhelmed and not sure what to choose from the mammoth menu try the royal red robin burger. The royal red robin burger is a tasty bacon cheese burger that is topped off with a sunny side up egg. It is magic between buns! The burger oozes with farm fresh goodness! Seriously!...what other burger joint incorporates all of your favorite farm animals (cow, pig and chicken) between two buns?!  The fries are piping hot and endless. Also, try the new pickle coins...these fried pickles are hands-down the best pickle chips on the face of the Earth! They are the right blend of salt, sour, vinegar and crisp. RR is not the best burger place, but it is a great burger chain. So fly on over to RR for consistent burgers and yummy fries. You won't be disappointed.

Strolling through the mall I saw a sign for a $6.99 burger with Mac n cheese. Decided to stop in and try it. I asked the host about the $6.99 burger special and she was one of the most clueless workers I ever talked to. A host should atleast know a little bit about specials and the menu. I excused her and just read thru a menu myself and since I saw it on there I figured it was to be as the sign described it to be. The burger came out and was pretty small. For the Mac and Cheese on it, it was really no more than a spoonful lol the best thing about my meal was the unlimited fries and the dipping sauces (at extra cost) my waitress was very attentive but was a bit sassy. Overall I think a 3 star is the best way to describe it.
Not waiting 30- 45 + minutes to get seated for a burger So many screaming kids noise level was unbearable.

Two lunches in one week at Red Robin, Rockaway Town Square mall!?!  You have to believe that we are quite happy with this establishment! The first lunch was a quite rendezvous with my lady. We don't often find the time to be alone together. We ordered two different burgers from the extensive menu and when the meals and drinks arrived, we were NOT disappointed. We held hands, talked and just enjoyed the quiet and ambiance.  An excellent afternoon tryst.  Just three days later, we returned to the same Red Robin, but this time as grandad (Da) and grandmother (Umma) with our special needs grandson "D".  "D" can be unruly but he was on his good behavior. He used his inside voice and did not bother the other diners.  He was NOT perfect, but our server and the staff were attentive and considerate. They took our order and they we're pleased when "D" asked for 'chez sanwch' and fries with bubble water. We ordered two new choices of burgers and, again, we were quite happy with our selections.  Red Robin has been a pleasant lunchtime destination. We were happy with the staff and service. The ambiance was good. The food was delicious and abundant. The price was reasonable. I highly recommend Red Robin for your next lunch time treat.

Loyal Red Robin customer - this location has gone downhill rapidly over the last 6 mo.  Hostess lacks customer care skills - like being friendly for one.  Nice benefit to waiting for a table is they will call your cell when table is ready - but last night my table was given away to someone else.  Sat at a table that was still wet from being wiped down.  Not just table but seats.  Had to take napkins to wipe them off.  Ok, no big deal.  Then they seat a group of 10 next to us - at a table that fits 8.  So seriously bumping elbows.  They said they were so close they should pay our bill - lol.  Menus were greasy.  Ok but food should be good as it usually is, right?  Well no.  DGB burger - bottom roll was wet through like it had been soaked in butter - like a wet sponge, inedible.  Plates were dirty, silver dirty, glasses cloudy.  Fries were good but not a full portion as before.  Waiter did not offer more fries, more drinks, nothing.  Bathroom had papertowel strewn around the floor exploding out of the garbage. And felt sick immediately after eating - and through the night.   Used to go here at least twice a month - something has changed - manangement? greeters? cooks?  Not going back again.

Took my family to this place because they sent my wife a free burger for her birthday.  Little did we realize we would pay the price.  We put in our order together with drinks and 50 min later we were still waiting for our food and drinks.  The place was maybe 40% full.  We never saw our waitress after taking our order.  We were getting irate as no one came by.  My son finally got his burger but not the rest of us.  We asked the Manger where was the rest of our food and drinks.  He said he would look into it.  He never came back or apologized.  The order was wrong and we still had to ask for our drinks.  We saw another family come and we're seated next to us.  We saw they didn't clean the mess on the floor for that table.  That was enough for us.  We had really bad service and didn't care for the food.  The management doesn't really care about customer service by ensuring satisfaction.  Lucky for us we were not in a rush as this ordeal was over two hours.  Safe to say we will NEVER come back.

I can't think of a premium burger chain that tries as hard as this Red Robin to please guests. On a recent visit for lunch with a friend, the service was fast, the bacon cheeseburger delicious, and the unlimited steak fries were great (not greasy) and perfectly cooked. Okay, maybe you shouldn't have to pay this much for a couple of cheeseburgers and fries at lunch, but you know what, the service here is so friendly and competent (thank you, Amanda!) that we were glad to pony up the cash.

Where to start...... so not impressed! The greater/host was very friendly and spoke to us and got us seated right away. Our server was very nervous and not great at her job. She barely checked in on us and when I asked for something it took me reminding her twice before I got an item. When our food came out both of the burgers we ordered tasted gassy, like they had the grill turned way too high up. My burger came out missing half of the toppings it was supposed to come with. Neither one of us finished our burgers because of the gassy taste, and our fries were nothing to write home about.  Needless to say, I don't have an urge to go back to a red robin any time soon.
Food was ok. Bathrooms are disgusting and the service was absolutely horrible. Not much else to say.

We tried out Red Robin for the first time and I must say we had a bittersweet time.  The food we ordered was awesome. Their chicken burgers and sandwiches are phenomenal.  So is the lemonade.  What I'm most disappointed with is the not so great service we received.    We had to ask for napkins and utensils after we received our meal because they didn't provide them right away, like most restaurants do.  And between ordering our meal and seeing our waiter took about 20 minutes.  The food arrived by someone else.  I felt the food was great but we were forgotten about by the staff.  I won't be going back anytime soon.

The service is SO SO SO SO SO slow.  It takes forever for everything - milkshakes, bottomless sides, etc.   I think they do bottomless items because they know they won't lose money anyway.. people give up before they ever get it!

This place is okish!! I went there a few times, the food was ok at best!!! Stuff average at best!!! It was hard to get their attention! Took 20 min to get a beer! I got lots of attitudes from the bar tender!! I went twice and I don't think I would never go back!! I rather the pub muldoons!!!

Came with the family first time. Place looked busy and clean. Appetizer onion rings were good. We order 2 burgers and they messed up on one of the orders. Our waiter disappeared for 15min. Manager came out said sorry for the mess up and have them cook me a new one but told them I didn't want to wait. Fries were cold too. Place has a mall entrance as well. Slow service and my food being cold, that's 1 star. With manager and place being clean 2 more stars. Will try again soon...
The hostess was friendly & nice, out waitress very helpful, personalble & professional  - food & service was  excellent- we'll be back!
Food's pretty good and one of the few restaurants that has a vegan veggie burger.  But as many have said, the service here is horrendous. Just total chaos 24/7.
John M. - Food was good, service lacking. Waiter not attentive at all. Bottomless fries a good offer but there is no one around to give them to you! Can't see us coming back here anytime soon...

I love the food here, and we've always had great service. I don't care for the remodeling- it looked better before when you could sit at the bar and look over the whole restaurant. Now they closed off the bar area and they don't have booths at the bar anymore. This place is very popular and gets crazy on friday and saturday nights and it's a family place (so, loud kids and babies) so  if you'd like a more relaxing dining experience, go someplace else or order to-go. But overall, the food is amazing and the service is always great.

My family and I typically visit Red Robin about once a month, sometimes twice. Most visits are satisfactory, but once in a while we have a terrible experience. For example, tonight we had dinner there. Three of us got burgers, ordered "some pink" and two of us got salads. The first time around the burgers came with no pink and were dry to the bite. We all agreed to send our burgers back, and when they came back, they weren't any better. Still no pink, but this time were very greasy. Also, our salads were shorted on toppings leaving us unsatisfied. However, Red Robin did comp our burgers, as they usually do when something isn't satisfactory.  This place isn't terrible, but honestly, if you want a tasty burger, I would opt for Wendy's.
I am disgusted I come into this place of business and find goldfish at my feet and it made my red robin experience terrible
I enjoy there food but when you call to place an to go order there very rude. I work in customer service I would never speak to anyone like that.

I had dinner here last week. I had the Pig Out Double. I expected good size hamburgers. What I got were burgers that were as big as burgers from Burger King. The food was good but for the price it wasn't worth it.

Came on for dinner on 9/5/2015 at 6pm. Though there were tables available we had a 15 minute wait which was fine for a Saturday night dinner but we wish we hadn't. Our server Scott had to apologize multiple times for the food taking too long. Two other servers had to bring our appetizer and entre.  BEWARE there are tablets available on each table that you can use to contact your server, order drinks, and play games to pass time. Our food was so slow to come out that we noticed some trivia questions popping up that you could play and asked you if you wanted to play the next question. NO WHERE on the screen did anything notify you or tell you that you would be charged an "entertainment fee." When it came time to pay the bill (which you pay on the tablet we noticed a $1.99 entertainment fee). Again our server was no where to be found and we paid the bill. Once Scott did attend to the table we asked about the fee and he said that it was has been a common issue and has been logged by multiple people that the pop up does not come up. Scott said he would have to the manager come to our table and give us an entertainment fee credit. When the manager came to the table he started to yell at us that the pop up comes on the screen 2 times (which it does not) and rudely hands me a piece of paper that does not offer a credit but a "word about credit cards" and tells me to ask questions and contact guest support on the red robins website and walks away. It's only $1.99 but it's the principal of the thing.  You've lost a customer over a little fee because of the rudeness of the management staff.

Services is always slow but I still returned because I enjoy their Turkey Burger. Tonight it was a soggy bland mess.   I can't justify forcing others to eat here and think it's meh when the only item I enjoy is so disappointing too.  It's a shame because I really wanted to enjoy it.
Great burgers! Burgers are always seasoned and cooked to perfection. Fries are delicious too. Try the A1 peppercorn burger or the chophouse burger

This particular Red Robin is in a mall, so it's usually busy and the service is mediocre. However, they have a system that sends you a text message when your table is ready, so you are free to roam the mall while you! Excellent concept!

Went here a few times food was about average. It has a fun environment and ok prices. However, in my last experience we were sat down during a non-busy hour and waited a half hour for no service. Will not return and will not recommend.

This restaurant is definitely a disappointment. I ordered carry out for myself and a couple of kids and the entire order was wrong. I had double checked the receipt but should have double checked the actual food before leaving the restaurant! The wrap I ordered was the wrong one, and we were all missing sides and extra toppings. Not to mention, the staff was very rude and the service was slow. I'll probably never come back here again.

I love Red Robin burgers and I love Red Robin fries and I love Red Robin shakes and I love Red Robin's giant draft beers and I LOVE this Red Robin for being open when we had no power!   Yes, the wait for 7 of us to be seated was about an hour and 15 minutes at a time when we were dragging and starving, but when I overheard the manager chewing out a waitress who had been there for 2 hours who was complaining that she needed a break, telling her that "the rest of us have been here for 9 hours already and all of these people waitiing have no power and are counting on us tonight" I wasn't leaving.  If I could have kissed her without getting punched by my wife I would have. When we were finally seated ny the same manager she saw the look on our faces and gave us a free appetizer-she was awesome and I'm sorry I didn't get her name.  Our waiter got to us quickly and we all got our drinks quickly (thank GOD since I needed a beer that night).  We all ordered burgers or chicken sandwiches and when they came it was like a bunch of sharks in a feeding frenzy.  It may have been the hunger, or the tiredness, but the Prime Chophouse burger was seriously one of the best burgers I ever had.  You know what I mean...when it's so good you don't want to finish it because then yuo'll just be sad that the feeding is over?  Yeah, THAT good. Thanks to all the folks that worked WAY too many hours that night to feed Morris County!!!

Have you been to one? Well if you been to one.. you been to all. The staff is friendly, professional and also helpful. Great for kids, have a bar, also located at the Rockaway mall. It is a burger place unless you didn't know. The A1 peppercorn burger is ok but rather salty. Most things are rather salty to me here but everything can't be peaches and cream.

I took my family and friends there for Sunday lunch since I had decent food. But this time they burnt three burgers including mu plate. I mean totally burnt. Taste like coal after few bites.    Chef or cook must knew it it was totally burnt like coal but they serve them. Covered with cheese on the top.  Instead of make new burger, they cover the burnt meat and serve them to our parties. Are you kidding me. Never eve going here again world end with hunger. They should have camera put up top of kitchen so we all could see what's happening inside.  It's just moral issue of fat cook who made our burger.

The Smoke and Pepper burger was delicious although the bacon needed to be crispier.  Great ciabatta roll.   The fries and onion rings were good, but are just the plain ol' variety that you find in any diner.  My biggest complaint is the dirty plates.  All had some residue on them.  We used napkins to cover the plates.  Luckily the burgers sit on a sheet of paper. Otherwise I would've been disgusted.

A friend and I stopped in on Friday night for a quick bite to eat. I had been to this location before, and I never expect anything great. It's nice to have a place in the mall with table and a bar, but the food - typical chain restaurant fare - is mediocre at best.  But Friday had to have been the worst experience. David was our server and he was extremely unhelpful, slow, and completely absent (until he wanted us to pay). It took us 15 minutes to get drinks to the table and get our food order taken (even though we mentioned we were ready to order everything when we ordered our beers).  When the beers did arrive, the glasses were filthy. Lipstick and grime on both. We were lucky we ordered bottled beers because David didn't return until well into our meal to see how everything was, so we would have been waiting a while. He wasn't even around for us to mention anything. He did apologize for the excessively gross glassware when he did finally check on us.  The orders were correct, but the food is never truly great. But that's a problem with the chain as a whole rather than an issue with this specific restaurant.   Once we finished our burgers, it was clear that David wanted us out, even as we were still finishing our drinks. He asked if we were familiar with the pay at table system (I was), so he mentioned we can pay at any time, no rush. Two minutes later, he came back to see if we had questions about it; we didn't. Another moment later, he came back to ask if we were going to use the system or wanted to pay in cash. In the guise of being helpful, he offered to split the check for us separately. This was nice, but something I've done myself as a customer before. So it read as forceful. He brought up the check on the tabletop system again for us to show us. We took the hint, chugged our drinks, and paid.  We were not there an excessive amount of time, we were ignored for most of our stay, then pushed out the door.  And while David stood out on this particular visit, I would hate to pinpoint him. I have been to this location several times and the service is never very good.  I'll be checking Muldoon's next time I'm looking for an option in the mall.

This place should be simple, great and fast.  It is anything but that.  The first time we went on a Friday night with another couple.  The place was busy so there was a long wait to be seated.  This is to be expected though, and the text to phone let us know exactly when to come back.  Onto the wait staff.  This first visit the order was mixed up, burgers weren't cooked to ordered temps and deleted mayo etc from burgers was still included.  Totally disappointed. So we decided to give the place a second chance.  BIG mistake.  This time it was a Tuesday night and less than 50% of the tables were occupied.  We were seated immediately, BUT it took 15 minutes for the wait staff to come to our table for us to order drinks.  We ordered soup and sandwich combos.  From the time we were seated to the time we left was 1 hour and fifteen minutes.  Most of that waiting for our food and beverages.  Very sad.  This place could be so good.
Basic Burgers. Nothing fancy. Just your basic franchise.

Service is incredibly slow. Food was not great at all, honey mustard sauce has seeds in it, half and half cream for coffee is frozen. The only reason this place gets any business is because its in the mall. First time here and it will definitely be the last.
I've been to this place many times and I loved it every time. Good food, right near mall and good service. I liked it.
Very long wait, dirty menus, dirty bathroom. Hair on menu.  Ugh. Other places have better burgers.  It's in a mall. There are better choices in the mall

Went in today for lunch after doing some Christmas shopping! I can honestly say I love red robin and I go atleast once a month. I have never tried this location before so I gave it a try! I ordered the big onion ring tower with the campfire sauce that was great but, when it came time for my food I was disappointed. I ordered a BBQ burger in a lettuce wrap instead of a but and when I got my burger there was no lettuce wrap or bun. I just cut it up and ate it anyway because they seemed busy. Mistakes happen so I didn't say anything about it but, when I started on my fries they seemed "extra crispy!" Luckily they are bottomless fries because I got another order and those were fine! Place was very clean and staff was nice, must have just been one of those days!

Came to this place in the rockaway mall. The decor was nice inside, there was no wait. The staff was friendly but they took forever to periodically come back to table to ask what we needed or bring something we asked for. Food was good, nothing exciting. Not sure if I would go here again by choice.
I always sit at the bar.  Bartender is always super attentive.  Food is really good.  Love that the fries are unlimited.  Very busy on the weekends being in the mall, parking is always atrocious.
Good food, good service and cold beer. This beats eating in the food court in the mall. You have to try the Octoberfest burger.  I am glad they brought it back this year.

Whenever I am taking a trip to or from NYC this is always a favorite place to stop.  The burgers and fries are phenomenal and cooked perfect to my liking every time. If your interested in my Burger tear-down check out my other Red Robin review. The reason this get's knocked a star is the service here is always spotty. The most recent time our waitress only stopped by 4 times. Once to order drinks and food, second to bring drinks and food as the same time, and lastly to bring the check, take it, then bring us the receipt. We got our drinks WHEN the food came out. I've never had this happen at a red robin. She only stopped to refill our drinks when she brought the check. I asked when we ordered at the beginning and also when we got our food if I could get a bottle of the seasoned salt to buy to bring home (I usually get one when I'm at red robin) and eve though I asked twice I never got one, though I was never billed for one too so that's good. I was going to ask at then end but was frustrated so I didn't bother. I will still stop through here every time I pass through because the food is always great. I just hope in the future the service gets better.

Good food, friendly service, food is always good wait staff never tries to rush you. It's not like most fast food joints, the food tastes like it has care behind it.  You can never beat the price, it's a great place to go when you have a big family. AND you can never ever beat endless fries!!!

Yes, it's another chain and the food is typical chain style.  Sure they have burgers, mandatory selection of salads, sandwiches, and the onion tower looks cool, but at the end of the day, it's just another chain restaurant that works so well in America.  The bottomless sides is a gimmick that would fatten your belly.  The service is friendly.  If a chain restaurant is your style, then it's not a bad place.

My family, 5 in all, went on a Monday night. There was little traffic in the dining area, so we assumed this would be a fairly simple meal with no issues. It took almost 15 minutes for a waiter to actually show up and ask us for our drink order. 15 minutes later, the appetizer finally showed up. Then another 15 for the meal. My daughter ordered a kids pizza, which came out as macaroni and cheese. Another 10 minutes. 20 later we got refills on the drinks.  It took another 15 to get the check and 10 more to close it out.  All in all, this was over 1:15 for 3 burgers, a pizza and some wings. The waiter was off hanging out. He stood at the pass bs'ing with the rest of the staff. Not going back obviously.

good burger place. unlimited fries. had a goofy waiter. met up with a friend after work and it's conveniently located off rt 80 attached to the rockaway mall. draft beer specials were misleading. specials only applied to select beers (ie coos and bud).

Gave these Guys another chance after a somewhat dismal experience last time. Besides it was a free Birthday burger so what's the harm. I was pleasantly surprised. The usually mind numbing wait time was gone. The server was cordial and professional and the food was .. Well , awesome. 3 words ... Big Sky Burger ! They must have listened to the old reviews and got their act together . Bravo Red Robin, I'll be back !

Whenever we go to the one in Rockaway there is a huge wait and service is very slow......  The food is ok. Fridays level quality. Good when you have kids but there are better places when you are looking for an adult meal

We first tried a Red Robin when we were out in Hershey. After satisfying our beer tasting at the Troeg's Brewery, we hit up that place, and became instant fans. My fiancee and I came here to the NJ location last Saturday for dinner before we went to Skylands Christmas Show. After all, what beats alcoholic milkshakes and towers of onion rings? We go in, and the hostess says there's a 45 minute wait. Now granted it looked busy, but there was an area by the bar that had a table for two that was empty!! My fiancee then points this out, to which we receive the snarky reply from the Kim Kardashian clone.... "Umm...you can go seat yourselves..." We were in positive moods before, and thankfully the rest of the wait staff were quick and all smiles! The waitress we had in particular, we forget her name but she was a red-head, did a very timely job of keeping us satisfied. Plus we had stuffed ourselves and then had enough for leftovers for the next day. As far as the hostess goes, that will be for someone else to post.

This was a stop made in route to go home for the holidays... I've experienced better.  Not to say that I really expected too much from Red Robin, I mean in my opinion its literally just one step up above a fast food restaurant... if that.  I ordered a chicken sandwich and a margarita - hey, it's the holidays, it's time to celebrate! The rest of my party ordered the same small burger, made the way they wanted and with a order of Onion rings, we were ready to eat.  As our food came out, the rest of my party did not like their burgers one bit. Thankfully my chicken sandwich was scrumptious, although that could be for the massive amount of mayo they lopped onto it... whatever, I was hungry. Additionally, my margarita wasn't too strong and that was a bummer. When it comes to restaurants I usually don't judge them based upon their lack of food, especially a place like this. The reason why it gets a lovely two stars is due to the fact that our waitress just wasn't nice. Having worked in restaurants before, I know what good quality service is and she just did not cut it.  Needless to say, my tip reflected her behavior and I will not be returning.  Next time we head to NJ, you better believe that we'll be stopping at BW3s and skip right on past Red Robin.

I'm being generous...only because the server was a really nice kid who was trying hard to make us feel comfortable.  It's the food that's the problem.  If not for the server working so hard, I would be giving Red Robin a one star rating. This is just like any other chain, it's interchangeable with Fridays, Ruby Tuesday and son on.  The only difference is that there aren't any other ones in the area.  I have been to one in VA a bunch of years ago and remember the food being better.  It probably wasn't, I probably just evolved.   Like I said, the server was nice, attentive and even cheery.  They definitely earn points for their customer service.  The meal I ordered tasted nothing like it was described in the menu.  The chocolate milk ordered for my son was more like an over sweetened milkshake, obviously just a crap load of Hershey's.  Be original and try not to kill off the youngest of clients.  The onion crisps or whatever they are called were nothing more than a pile of tasteless grease.  The chicken on my sandwich was very mediocre with zero flavor.  Even the bun was lousy.  It all tastes like mass produced slop that will kill you if you eat it often enough.  I would rather eat good tasting food if it's going to kill me. If you aren't into flavor or real food, go for it.  Otherwise, head over to another nearby grease joint that at least has flavor and semi original decor.

I've reviewed this chain restaurant before...the one in Clifton so, I'll not rehash how much we like the burgers that they offer.  It still holds true here, AND they had a few more options to try.  Very good. The only thing lacking here was slow service.  Very slow.  Go here if you have some extra time to kill. Still...this chain has it down pat as far as food.

Service is terrible. TERRIBLE. We ordered two apps and two entrees. Apps never made it to the table. Took nearly 40 minutes for food to get to the table. Everyone around us is getting food. Finally flagged down the waiter to let him know we were still waiting on apps. Then our entrees arrived without the appetizers. Manager came over and said "well I took the appetizers off the bill..." Thanks. We never got them. So why would you charge us? No favor to us. The margaritas we ordered were 100% sweet and sour mix. Perhaps that is why There were fruit flies buzzing over head constantly. Disgusting. Sent the drinks back. I get that it is a red robin at the mall but seriously?! We were very hungry and figured RR would be a safe bet. Won't make that mistake again. We would have been better off at the food court.

Went here with my dh and 2 boys only had to wait about 10 minutes before we we were seated.  We ordered fairly quickly we ordered an appetizer onion rings and drinks arrived very quickly but was a little disappointed with the onion rings they cost $9.00 basically it is a dollar per ring kind of disappointing. We ordered hamburgers and kids meal and they were just ok not bad nothing to complain about but we waited a long time for our waitress to return I think she was very busy we would probably come again if we are in the area my only suggestion would be for the management to clean the bathrooms

Bottomless fries. Is there anything more to be said??? The burgers were good, decent selection of beer on tap, good service. I am not a fan of chain restaurants, but this was actually just what we needed today and I would certainly go again.

They should consider a name change to Red Ripoff.  I ordered one of their supposed bigger burgers for $8.99 and when they served it, the burger was an Air Burger.... Meaning more air than meat.  Service and courtesy excellent, burger thickness/content very very skimpy.  Will not go back again.

I was really waffling between two and tree stars on this place and decided on three because only one item was yucky poo.  My spouse order a cup of clam chowder that was very good.  We also had pork ribs that were a little greasy but overall OK. I order a cheese burger, and this is where the yucky poo come in.  The meat appear to have been precooked, and left to sit for a re-warm,  dry and tasteless doesn't come close to describing this, it came with a stale bun and an browned out piece of ice burg lettuce.  I cut the burger in half,  piggy the spouse ate all of his commenting that it didn't taste all that great . I basically took a bite of my half and left the rest.  The waitress came over and asked how we like the food. I gave her the old yucky poo and the manager came over.  She actually refunded the price of the burger, even though piggy the spouse had eaten half of it.  I was pretty impress that they did this.  I didn't expect this.  The service was good. The decor is nothing special, it's a chain, but a chain that appears to be trying to listen to its customers.  The TV was tuned to a rerun of a 1990's football game (What with that?) We might give it another try.  In my opinion the food is somewhat overpriced, $8.99 is really pretty pricy for a less than Mickey Dee's quality burger.

On a recent burger kick (I've tried about twelve places on my lunch hour in New York over the past few months), I felt it was time to try the nearby Red Robin.  I've never been to a Red Robin location, and while I cannot rule out going back, I am in no rush to provide repeat business. The service was absolutely atrocious.  I was told my takeout order (very simple--an A1 Peppercorn Burger) would take 10-15 minutes, but alas, at the 15 minute mark, there was no update on my burger.  No "just a few more minutes"--in fact, even at the 20 minute mark, it required ME asking the two bartenders (neither of whom was doing much in the way of work) for an update--they did not strike up a conversation to reassure me that the order was on its way.  After staring blankly for several moments, they finally looked at my order on the computer and, without giving me an update, one of them went over to the grill. He came back about 3-4 minutes later and simply said it wasn't ready.  No update on this, no "sorry, the order must have not gone through," nothing.  Another few minutes went by and he went back to the grill and again came back with no burger.  While I do appreciate his offering me a free drink while I waited, it was still vexing to get no concrete update on the status of my order. The burger eventually came at about the 33 minute mark.  The other bartender (the one who had not been checking on the grill) rang me up and offered nothing in the way of an apology.  No coupon/money-taken off the order.  No "sorry, we're swamped today."  Nothing.  As if the service and wait had not been utterly unacceptable. It was unclear what caused the delay.  The restaurant had a reasonable crowd, but they were far from fire-hazard levels.  There was no indication that the order did not go through.  All I could gather from this is that take-out orders take between 30 & 40 minutes, and yet they'll mislead you by telling you they'll take 10-15.  Truly unacceptable--I would MUCH RATHER have learned that they forgot to input my order than found out the takeout process is so absurdly lengthy. As for the food, it was a bit disappointing.  Burgers seem entirely dictated by the toppings--if you get a well-dressed burger, you'll be happy.  But, on its own, the patty is bland. Their fries were nothing if not overhyped.  Just basic, generic steak fries. To the restaurant's credit, I heard from a buddy that works in the mall that the service is not ordinarly atrocious.  But you only get one chance to make a first impression, and my first impression of Red Robin is beyond horrible.
Great food and great service! I love the fact that they have call ahead and you can walk around the mall and they will text you when your seat is ready so you don't have to wait with a rowdy child.

We stopped here one night for dinner before going shopping. My biggest complaint about this shopping center has been the lack of sitdown places to eat. This restaurant fills that need. The prices are reasonable, the food and service are great. My favorite thing to order is the root beer float. It was like $2.99 or so with unlimited refills.  There is usually a wait to get into it. We went there one Friday night at 7:30 and there was a 45 minute wait.
I went there for lunch today.  It took forever to get my food and was overpriced.  The food was OK at best, but would not go back.

whomp whomp...I used to like their hummus dish but they changed it. so instead of having several veggies / pita to dip you get thick chunky cucumbers and potato chips!?!? seriously, potato chips with hummus?  I went earlier this week - I had a salad and soup. I barely touched it. The salad was soaked in dressing! I think it would have been decent if I could taste the food through the dressing. I don't remember the soup much just that I barely touched it.  places like this remind why America's health is soo bad!

I've only been here twice and I've gotten the hunk of burning love burger done medium both times.  Both times it was excellent. My only complaint is the first time I was here the hostess turned to my mother and asked if I wanted a children's menu.  I'm 28!!!  Needless to say, I was carded for my Ultimate Margarita, which was also pretty good.  The second time I was there, I was neither offered a children's menu or carded.
Great food and friendly service!  Very Clean place. They will text you when your table is ready so you can shop around the mall instead of just sitting there.
Great salted caramel shakes! Really liked my cheeseburger too. Good service at 1:00 PM on a Monday.
Been there a few times.  I'm not a fan of the fries, but love the burgers and bottomless root beer float.  I personally like their burgers better than 5 Guys's.

I realize this is a chain restaurant and 99% percent of those suck. Red Robin is no different. This is a 'burger' chain, right?? Then how come they can't cook a burger as ordered? Is it really that hard when you cook burgers all day, every day? I ordered the "Smoke and Pepper" burger because I was starving and the picture looked amazing. I ordered it medium rare. It came out with limp, almost rare bacon and was fully cooked through, easily medium well. I didn't want to send it back but luckily (the very good, attentive) waitress had them take it off the bill.  I ended up going next door to Cups to get some frozen yogurt before I had to get to work. I will not be back to Red Robin, nor will the friend I had lunch with. Total waste of money. If you want a burger that's cooked perfectly and tastes delicious, walk past Red Robin, go into Macy's, take the down escalator, turn left when you get off and walk straight to Muldoon's - where you'll get a burger that will be worth the money charged for it.

I hate this review as our family loves going to Red Robin. However this one is just too slow. They don't have enough servers for the tables, and while the kitchen appears packed, food takes forever. Our most recent visit saw us waiting 30 minutes just to receive the guac dip appetizer and a kids meal. Once the meals came, they somehow managed to forget the onion straws on one of the burgers. We didn't dare send it back for fear of how long it would take.  Regarding the guacamole dip, I don't know why Red Robin has decided to shrink it so dramatically, but it is no longer worth ordering. The lack of attention prevented us from ordering another round of drinks. One might consider this a good thing. We will continue coming here every so often, but you HAVE to go when it is practically empty.

This is the 3rd time im going to this Red Robin. I got to say everytime i go here, the food is Excellent. You get seated immediately when you walk in and your waiters or waitresses are really kind and usually helpful. Ive tried 4 of the burgers and they are amazing. Definitely go for their ice cream milkshakes too. Price is usually around the $35 range for two people with food and a beer each.

Our third visit, another problem.  We were promptly seated, and the waitress took our order.  A party of three got seated behind me, then four people got seated in the booth in front of us. finally a party of about 8 young guys got seated.  Each of the three tables received their food,n we r still waiting for our burgers.  In fact the table in front of us not only received their food, they finished and got their check. Burger was overcooked, smothered w/ greasy onions, cold bacon.
It's okay. Inconsistent at best though. The BBQ burger was pretty greasy. Service was good and fries were fresh.

Took 45 minutes to get two orders of grilled chicken salad and a appatizer while burgers were coming out left and right. Server kept ignoring the table we had. When it almost hit the 40 min mark we asked for the bill at the same time so we could make a movie we had tickets for. Our waiter had brought our bill before our food had even finally came. For just two grilled chicken salads! The chicken was coldish implying it sat there cooling down for a while too. Atrocious service.

I have been here a few times and have not been super impressed.  The food is pretty decent, but the service could be better.  It seems to take forever for them to refill your beverage and I hate having to ask them for another drink.  If my glass is empty and my food is not there assume that I am going to want another.  i do have to say the place is pretty clean and the restroom was free of debris which is a plus.
The last time we went there it was not crowded, but it took forever to get our food. We were told that they had a back up in the kitchen?  Not sure what that meant,

As much as I like the food, and it's the only close one (not driving 30+ min for a burger) the service never seems to get any better. Was seated quickly, but the waitress took 15 min to come over and take our drink order, and at the time food as well. Took 5 mins to get the drinks (seated right by the kitchen). Appetizer arrived and no one brought napkins or utensils. Food arrived and I had to ask for napkins and the response was "oh, I'm so sorry" yet she worked the table next to use quickly and brought everything to them without a problem (not sure if being a bigger table mattered). When the check arrived and she eventually took it, I watched her b.s. with another waitress while she took her time processing my card. Instead of bringing the check back over, she had to balance a tray of food, 3 drinks and my check at once. Yes that's a great way to make sure everything is out, but it took way too long for a simple card swipe. I've had worse service there, but for some reason they never seem to wow me when I'm there.
Good food at a moderate price. However every time I come here it takes forever to get served. There's always "problems in kitchen" no matter what time of day.  Service is so slow.

For a Red Robin it's not bad.  Just remember, you walked into a Red Robin so don't expect anything super great.  I've been here twice, one time because the buffalo wild wings wasn't open yet and I came all the way to Rockaway so I figured I'd try this instead of leaving hungry.  It wasn't bad.  Service is fast, but the place isn't that clean.

A real hit or miss place, The service is either spot on which is usually first thing when they open or on a weekday lunch or terrible slow and wrong which is always on a weekend. The manager is quick to comp things which is not always a great idea if your trying to manager a business... I don't want my food for free I want it right the first time. The french onion soup is the most inconsistent soup I have ever had some days its so bland if it weren't for the color you would think you were eating water and other days you might as well pour the salt shaker in your mouth, I have given up on the soup.

Decent burger place. I've had better burgers elsewhere, but nothing beats Red Robin's strawberry lemonade. I went here post hurricane for a warm meal and some heat. The place was packed, but I was expecting that since nobody had power and wanted some place to warm up. What was really neat is their wait system. We came and were told that there was a 30-45 minute wait (can't blame them!). The hostess took our information on an iPad (which I thought was neat) and also took my cell phone number. What they used with the phone number was about 30 minutes later texted us to tell us that our table was ready! We were able to walk around the mall and not worry about our name getting called when we were gone. We walked in when they texted us and were immediately seated! Moreover, in the initial text, they give you a link to check on your place in line. Red Robin is known for their burgers, so that is what I got. I am a sucker for hot food so I ordered the Cry Baby style burger (ghost pepper ketchup, fried onions, among other things). The burger came with their unlimited fries. I also ordered the strawberry lemonade. The strawberry lemonade came in a pretty neat glass. The lemonade comes with real strawberries in it which were so good. While the glass is deceptively small and the drink is on the higher end price wise, it is bottomless, so you are not actually being ripped off! The food came out really fast. The burger was pretty good. All the ingredients worked well together (I added some cheese since it wasn't included). Since it was named the Cry Baby burger, I expected to be crying, but it was far from hot. I didn't break a tear or a sweat. The burger was good even though I didn't cry. The fries are really good steak fries as well (these are also bottomless). Overall, it was a good experience. We had to wait a little for our check, but otherwise service was decent. Will go back!

Its REd Robin!!!  Burgers are great.  This particular restaruant is usually mobbed. Its in a shopping mall after all.  So , if your not in a hurry during peak meal times and want the food,  it holds up well. We usually go either just before or after the lunch crowd, or around 330/ rpm for dinner here. I have no patience for waiting and there are too many other joins that are close where you can eat. Our last stop was today around lunch time.   Seated right away, waiter was on top, but messed up on a soda/ no biggie.  I prdered dr pepper, and got a diet coke, but was fixed right away The food is good for what it is/ Red Robin.  A step above fast food

Not for black people.  Last night my neice and I went to the Red Robin in the Rockaway Mall New Jersey for a quick bite. Wrong move. We got to the restaurant about 7:35 p.m. We were taken to a dirty table. The greeter half cleaned the floor. First wrong move on our part. We sat. Ten minutes later the waiter took our order. We waited until 8:50pm and left to get our meal at the food court which was  opened. Thankfully.

I have been to this Red Robin a bunch of times and am just writing a review now for it. I think its a great place. Kid friendly for sure...food has always come out piping hot. The food in my opinion is fantastic for a franchise place. Their selection of gourmet burgers with the bottomless fries has me coming back for more. Whenever I am there, I seem to be picking out the next burger to try on my next trip there. Whether you like a plain cheeseburger or a true gourmet burger, I recommend this place highly. Also I must mention that the service is very accommodating and they look for reassurance that your visit is satisfying.

On the evening of May 21 I went to eat at this Red Robin (1st one I've ever been to), and had one of the best burgers I've ever tasted, the "Pig Out Style Tavern Double" Bacon Cheeseburger (is one of their special burgers for $6.99), with yummy sweet potato fries instead of regular fries, it was so delicious. This place was clean and the service was quick by super friendly and attentive waitress. I'm so sad there aren't any Red Robin restaurants in NYC or Queens. If there's Red Robin near you and you haven't yet tried their burgers you should ASAP, I'm sure you will love them. I can't wait to eat at Red Robin again.
I give the burger 5 stars. However, I'll take away a star for the inattentive waitress we had. She was extremely rude....as if I was doing her a favor by placing an order with her.

Went here for lunch with some friends on a Saturday afternoon. We had seen the commercials and since the burgers always looked so good we made a special trip to try it. Well we were seriously underwhelmed.  When we walked in the restaurant there was no one at the host station. There were however, two employees chatting away at the bar in no apparent rush to seat us even though they looked right at us.  After finally being seated our waiter appeared, took our order, and yawned in our faces. Obviously, our orders didn't entertain him. When our drinks came my friend picked up the container of sugar packets to add to her iced tea, and hiding behind it were dirty napkins and straw wrappers. I guess clean tables don't entertain them either. We ordered the onion ring tower for an appetizer, which I have to say were probably some of the best I have ever had. Although, the dipping sauces did leave a little to be desired.  Then the burgers came out. My boyfriend ordered the Whiskey River burger on the jalapeno roll, some pink. Our friend ordered the bacon cheeseburger with cheddar cheese and pickle relish, no pink. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger with cheddar, some pink. Mine and my boyfriend's orders came out fine. As our friend took a bite of her burger, she realized her burger was not cooked to her liking, indeed it was pinker than either of the some pink burgers. So she asked to send it back to have it cooked more. No big deal right? Well you would have thought she asked them to reconstruct the Coliseum. It took 20 minutes for them to come back with the recooked burger. When it finally came she asked for an extra plate, the waiter went to get it, but instead served another table first. You would think after making a patron wait so long to finally get her food they would try to get her what she needed asap.  My friend at this point was extremely angry and got up to speak to the manager. I will give them credit, however, because after the manager found out about our issues, we were met with an apology from everyone we had come in contact with and our meal was comped.  Even still, the burgers were mediocre at best and vastly under seasoned. The steak fries that they say are from America's best potatoes seemed like nothing more than a bag of frozen fries you can find in the freezer section of any grocery store. Plus the cost for basically America's simplest meal, a burger and fries, is a little much.  Everything totaled I don't think we will be returning to Red Robin. We'll stick to the tried and true, either Five Guys or Fuddruckers.
Melt-in-your mouth burgers, excellent wait staff and good beer and drinks choice.  Woohoo.  This place is brilliant!

Very good burgers but I think I am really done with this place.  The service is just beyond horrible.  My son & I went there during a weeknight.  10 minutes before our server introduced himself, and another 10 minutes before he came by to take the order.   Bottomless fries??  Well we asked for more, and they never came out.  Even though the server stopped by 2 times to see if we got them yet.  I mean don't they just go back and grab a handful to put back in your basket? This place is not worth it.

Red Robin is an upscale burger joint, sort of a cross between McDonalds and TGI Fridays. The decor is similar to the latter while the food resembles the former. The dining room is nicely appointed with lots of polished wood and expensive looking tile. A full bar occupies the center of the restaurant, although it wasn't doing much business on a weekday at lunch time. There are raised booths around the periphery of the dining room, where, I assume, the cool and attractive people are seated so as to be more clearly seen and admired by the riffraff below. I was shown to a less exalted station -- a small table behind a planter near the door to the mall. Nevertheless the service was fine.  I ordered a salad, a patty melt, and iced tea to drink. The salad was good -- a colorful assortment of greens and chopped vegetables sprinkled with bits of an orange cheese-like substance and served with a wedge of pita bread. I asked for Italian dressing. It came in a little tub, separate from the salad. I prefer salads to be tossed with the dressing so every piece is evenly coated, but it's not the end of the world if it's not. The dressing, unfortunately, had that gelatinous, slightly slimy appearance that tells you it came in a bottle from a factory. It was also loaded with sugar, but I think I'm in the minority in this country in not liking sweet salads. Italian it was not.  When I ordered the patty melt, the server asked how I wanted it cooked -- "pink or no pink." I said "no pink," but it came pink inside just the same. (Sometimes I wonder, what's the point?) Taking my life in my hands, I ate it anyway. And it was pretty good -- the burger was tender and juicy, the onions were nicely caramelized, and there was just the right amount of melted American cheese to glue everything together. It was served between two slices of grilled dark rye bread, which had a pronounced carroway flavor that I enjoyed, although I could detect no seeds in the bread.  All the sandwiches here are accompanied by steak fries, which the menu touts as being made with "America's highest-quality premium potatoes." I thought they were pretty mediocre. They had the uniformity of shape and color which indicated they had been hanging out in a plastic bag in the freezer rather than having been cut from fresh potatoes, premium quality or otherwise. They were also limp, lukewarm, and under seasoned.  So all things considered, I'd grade my meal here a B-, and at $18 not including the tip, it was quite expensive. Those "premium potatoes" don't come cheap I guess.

Tried it twice. I don't see the attraction. Burgers are so so, service is a no no. After waiting ridiculous time to be seated, then longer to get served with what is really just   fast food. A million better places for me.

There is a reason why I no longer frequent this Red Robin location, despite the fact that it is right in my own backyard. Mistakingly, last week I made an exception after receiving an e-mail regarding my free birthday burger as part of the Red Robin Royalty Program. In a nutshell, this Red Robin location truly is "for the birds"!!! Since its opening a couple of years ago I don't think I can really remember a time where the food didn't take FOREVER to come out, regardless of whether they are busy or not. Just read the reviews...nearly every reviewer says exactly the same thing! Even the people at the table across from us had complained about the ridiculous amount of time that it was taking to receive a burger, and had something comped on their bill...a typical sight at this Red Robin. My husband and I waited over a half an hour for our food, in which time our server never gave us any updates on the status of our meals. After all, the servers already know the deal...this is commonplace here. Besides the fact that my patty melt came out without onions, it was also burned to a crisp and black on the edges. By the time I had locked eyes with our server and signaled that I needed him, my husband was nearing the finish line on his dinner. I had come to the decision that I was not going to place a second order and wait close to another year for near frickin' fast food. I told our server that I was sending back my food, and as usual they send the manager right on over. The manager seemed pleasant enough but after a while you just get sick of hearing the same old "schpeel," if you know what I mean. He admitted that although there was no excuse for everything that transpired that evening, they are currently understaffed and are always trying to improve on things. It killed me to not respond, "I guess you have been understaffed since you opened your doors," but I bit my tongue. Otherwise I was painfully truthful in my complaint, and everything that I have typed in this review I stated to the manager. I even managed to tell him how I have never experienced any problems at their Clifton location, which is ALWAYS busy! He asked me if I wanted anything else but I told him that I didn't feel like waiting again, that my husband was basically done eating, and that we hadn't planned on being there that long. I'm not looking for a handout or anything, but just believe that a good manager would have comped my husband's burger...but figured perhaps they didn't because with all the comping going on there they must be near bankruptcy! Afterwards we ended up stopping by McDonald's, and even though I don't like their burgers very much anymore it was soooooo much more worth it! No aggravation, no wait (unless you count five minutes for FRESH fries!), and all this for a fraction of the price! The thing that really sucks is that my husband ended up cashing in on my birthday burger...Happy Birthday To Me!  :(

This is a good place for burgers. I've been there only once, and I enjoy the burgers and the endless fries...i only ate half of the bacon cheese burger, which was huge, and some of the fries. I had an ice cream shake, which was filling. THe atmosphere can be noisy at times, and service can be on and off. THey even have a bar near tvs for watching sports. Highly recomended.

This place is wonderful. The waiters and waitress give great service. The manager is funny and awesome; he knocked off a whole meal off our check because I had a few drops of water drip on me from the leaking ceiling from the snow. His words "I am so sorry, I told them this isn't the Rainforest Cafe and need to fix that roof but I don't know what happened." Hilarious guy!

RED ROBIN is the best family resturant around, great for all ages and the staff is very polite and helpful the prices are great and the food is delious (the best).Everything is excellent, no matter what you eat.
Had a 7pm burger with my son,and girlfriend one weekday evening. The was not too bad,.however our server was often no where to be found. We had to ask other servers for napkins etc.

Burgers were pretty good...decor is nice, however this place had a mildew/musty odor when we were there...They have a Happy Hour, I will probably try it again...unlimited fries with the burgers is nice.  Located inside the Rockaway Mall.

Granted, it's a stinkin Red Robin for crying out loud, but I've had more attentive service at McDonalds.  First, we were told the wait for our party of 5 (including 4 year old twins) would be 10-15 minutes.  Rather, it was more like 25 minutes.  Seated and after we received our drinks, waitress slow to come back for our order, even after everyone closed the menus.  It took about 45 minutes before the first dish hit the table (we told her to bring dishes out as they were ready as we were short on time).  On top of that, beverages weren't refilled unless asked and I had to wait for silverware after my meal finally arrived.  It became very clear the kitchen was running slowly that day, the waitress should have warned us but instead laughed at me when I asked.  That $45 could have been better spent elsewhere.

Been here a few times since they opened in November.  They needed to work out some of the "kinks" after the doors opened, but have gotten better as time has gone by. Still love the burgers, shakes, and food there which have been outstanding. Servers and managers have been helpful each time as well.

I have a huge issue with this place.  My fiance and I went here to try it out.  We went when they weren't busy at all.  We were seated once we entered.  We sat at the table for over 30 minutes with no service what so ever.  We watched the employees talk a mile a minute and take orders from the people after us.  When we finally got up annoyed the people next to us said they had been waiting for an hour and once they finished the last round in cards they were going to leave as well. I won't ever return.

Husband and I stopped in here while shopping in the mall. We have been to another location & it was great! This one, not so much. The waiter was never to be seen, we had to keep asking another waiter for our waiter just to get more drinks. The appetizers were awful - we had the Guac, Salsa and chips - well, the guac was just plain avocado with extra extra salt, and the salsa was literally, tomato sauce. We just ate the chips. I had a burger, it was good, my husband had the french dip which was extremely dry. I complained to the manager, nothing was done about it, we paid & left. I responded to the survey on the bottom of my receipt once I got home, then I heard from another manager. We spoke for well over 20 minutes on the phone about what went wrong - he said he wanted me to try it again as he promised that was not their belief for their customers. So he said he will be sending me a gift card to cover the full amount of what we paid during that trip. I never received it & never went back. I wasn't asking for a refund, I just wanted the manager to know the awful service and the awful appetizers

I've always been pleased with the burgers at red robin. I would love to try more menu items but I can't seem to let go of my sautéed shroom burger. The French onion soup is an excellent complement. The bottomless steak fries are a fantastic touch and I can search for the bottom! Waitstaff seems to get pissy if you want more than 2 refills but I scavenge off my other party member plates after that point anyhow; it just helps us leave quicker. If you bring kids and they order from the children's menu be sure to keep away from the pizza, it is GARBAGE. You wouldn't expect the child pizza at a burger place to be anything to write home about, but not even my toddler would eat it. Only a corporate mentality that focuses on numbers would think its worth serving.  The freckled lemonade is my beverage of choice, and there's good deals on happy hour drinks and appetizers in the bar, just make sure to ask to be seated accordingly. I come here whenever the opportunity arises.

I'd rather eat at a five guys or fuddruckers. The burgers are average at best, the prime rib dip is below average. The best burger they ever had was the Octoberfest burger, which was served on a pretzel bun (awesome). Aside from that, this place is a general disappointment.

Host/hostess area was very poorly run. They told everybody a smaller amount of wait time than there really was (told me 15 minutes, we waited 45) and they kept screwing up... We asked for a high chair and were treated as if we had asked for some sort of unheard of seating arrangement, or like we were a party of 30 or something. There did not seem to be any sort of rhyme or reason as to how they were seating people, I think because they all each had a plan for the tables but weren't communicating with one another.  Everybody who came up to the hostess station was told that they were "next"... how can every single party be next? By the time we were finally seated, our very well behaved children were cranky with hunger. The server was nice but rushed us to order and rushed us out of there, too, taking my plate away while I was still eating. The burger itself was alright... juiciness was ok but the "burger experience" was boring. If I tried this place again it would be without kids and I also would try a burger with some sort of "zest" to it. Also, I ordered it bunless but it came wrapped in SO MUCH lettuce that it was hard to even get to the burger through the lettuce (there was at least 1/4 of a head of iceberg on it... enough that I couldn't pick it up and it filled my entire basket with lettuce.) My husband thought his burger was ok but sort of boring, as well.  Daughter liked her corndog, though it took several reminders to the server for her to receive her chocolate milk. Overall, I think this COULD been an ok eating experience had they just been honest with me up front about how long it would take to be seated. If we hadn't been so rushed to order, I may have selected a different burger that I would have enjoyed more, as well. Just an example of how "front of the house" stuff can really sour a dining experience.
